iPad deal: Save on 10th-gen iPads

When Apple CEO Steve Jobs demoed the first iPad in 2010, the tablet made waves in the tech world. Everybody wanted that thin slab of glass that seemed like the ultimate magical computing device. When the original iPad went on sale later that year, it set records for Apple. Since then, Apple has continually raised the bar with regular upgrades. (The company also introduced three new models: iPad Air, iPad Pro and iPad mini).

The entry-level iPad still delivers excellent performance and value, with Apple’s typical premium hardware design. It’s the right choice for anyone looking for a device for consuming content, performing basic tasks and playing Apple Arcade games. (For an in-depth look at various iPad models, see our buying guide: How to choose the right iPad for you.)

If you need a new iPad, this deal delivers a quality Apple tablet at a pretty amazing price.

iPad (10th generation)

  • iPad (10th generation) with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 64GB SSD, Wi-Fi 6, 12MP front/12MP Back Camera, Touch ID, blue or silver colors — $349 $279
  • iPad (10th generation) with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 256GB SSD, Wi-Fi 6, 12MP front/12MP Back Camera, Touch ID, blue or silver colors — $499 $429.99 (with coupon box checked, see price at checkout)
  • iPad (10th generation): with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 256GB, Wi-Fi 6 + 5G Cellular, 12MP front/12MP Back Camera, Touch ID, blue, silver or yellow colors — $649 (currently not on sale)

Best budget iPad for years

Apple iPad (10th Generation)

4.5

The iPad 10th-generation is Apple's best entry-level iPad for years. Completely redesigned, it has a modern, all-screen design, faster processor and better cameras. Everything you want in an iPad at an affordable price.

Pros:

  • Cool modern design
  • Big 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display
  • 12MP front and back cameras
  • Wi-Fi 6 for fast streaming

Cons:

  • Limited 64GB storage
  • No Apple Intelligence
